ratings.question_text: I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: What is the name of your TA?
comments: Roa Fu and Jason
Jason Rauch
Jason Rauch and Rao Fu
there are several
Jason Rauch
Rao Fu&Jason Rauch
Rao and Jason
There were 3 TAs
Rao
Rao Fu, Jason Rauch
Rao Fu

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: Jonathan is an amazing statistics professor. His energy makes him the perfect instructor for a subject that while extremely important, can be unbearable. Very useful class.
Great course for all research students
The course is excellent, and Jonathan does a great job teaching it, but the topics can be hard to follow since the pace is so fast.
TAs never responded to emails. Unacceptable.
the professor is fantastic.
Jonathan's description of the statistical processes. The class notes were very useful.
Being able to use my own data for assignments and final project
The instructor was excellent. He was always available and helpful outside the class.
that is taught by the only Professor that can make you enjoy stats
Jonathan Reuning-Scherer is an excellent professor. His is dynamic and engaging in the classroom and helpful and supportive outside of class, offering constant advisement.
The Professor was extremely engaging and made class enjoyable. Statistics classes are usually painful.
The creative approach to teaching the subject matter. Very good visuals and examples.
The set of multivariate techniques taught

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: The statistical software can be frustrating.
It would be nice if the lecture was extended to STATA for students interested in economics.
Getting across an understanding of WHEN to use various techniques, i.e., what kinds of problems they are suited for.
I think the pace of the class is too much for easy comprehension. The class should be slower.

The course is at a weird intermediary level. The theory isn't delved into enough to really understand it. At the same time, we didn't spend enough time with the software packages to really pick them up. In many cases we were unable to do homework assignments with a particular software package. This meant we ended up jumping around packages and didn't learn one package particularly well.
The pace; if we slowed down the class a little bit so students could ask questions, I think students would get more out of it.
Need a class text book that students can follow

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: everyone was always available& very helpful
Both Jonathan and the TA's are very accessible and give clear and concise advice.
Great! Not always a lot of time, but easy to schedule and typically very helpful.
Excellent Professor. The TAs were not familiar with the three major software, SAS, R and SPSS. They knew only R. So that made me wait for appointment with the professor.

The availability and quality of help I received from Professor Reuning-Scherer was excellent. I did not seek assistance form the TAs because Professor Reuning-Scherer was available when I need help or advice. It is my understanding from other students that the TAs were also helpful and available.
The professor was very available for help and assistance, and easy to approach.
Excellent; the TAs and prof. definitely made themselves available during office hours to answer any questions students had.
Instructor and TAs never available by email., in person, they were very useful.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: I am interested in development and environmental economics, therefore need to understand how to pick the best statistical methodology in order to evaluate my data.
This was very important for my research data analysis, and my data had lot of variables and multivariate analysis was inevitable
Multivariate statistics are important to understand and be able to do in any science field, especially for those that are wanting to continue with school.
This course is an important quantitative addition to my degree program and fulfills one of the data analysis requirements of the MESc degree.
I wanted a general background in multivariate. I don't think I'll be using these methods in detail, however I did want a broad intro to to the subject matter.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Inform master's project data analysis project and prepare for continued research
For the analysis of my research data
Because I thought it would be important and useful for my Masters project and for my career.
See Question 15. I wanted to learn statistical analysis techniques.
I wanted to take a statistics course because I believe it's important to understand how to interpret statistics.
I wanted a general background in multivariate. This subject matter is very new to me, so I'm not sure that I would be using it in detail, but I wanted to have some exposure.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: yes, exceeded them
Yes.
Mostly; I think it would have been more useful to learn few techniques in a bit more detail
Yes
Yes
The course definitely lived up to my expectations.

I did not leave the course feeling confident in my ability to perform robust statistical analysis. In that sense, it did not meet my expectations, although I suspect it provides a solid foundation for future work.
Somewhat; it was a little too fast for me.
yes

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: yes
Yes.
Really, this form is repetitive.
Yes
I got exactly what I expected fromthe course.
See question 17.
Somewhat, see above.
yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: You get the chance to learn from others and reach a desirable consensus.
the only disadvantage of group work is scheduling meetings.
Working in a group helped me to learn more about the parts that I did not quite understand.
Group work was an important component of problem solving for the course.
Working in a group was extremely helpful in completing assignments. The disadvantage is that I didn't always completely engage in every assignment.
The advantages were that we were really able to learn from each other. The disadvantages were that the work was divided so that not all of us mastered all the material.
not really useful.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Choose a simple dataset you understand - and that has normal multivariate distributions.

I think if you are working on your own research data, this would help a lot. That might give you that extra energy to try hard to find the most satisfactory analysis. If you are working on borrowed data, I am not sure how much committed you will be to find the most accurate answer, as you might succumb to the tendency to do the homework assignments for the sake of finishing them, rather than deciphering the numbers properly.
Work in a group. Choose a data-set that you have experience with.
Be prepared for fast lectures. You'll have to spend time outside of class mastering the material.
get a good book
